data.title: Flickr: Discussing d5100 compatible lenses in Nikon D5100
data.meta_description: The safest and most inclusive global community of photography enthusiasts. The best place for inspiration, connection, and sharing!
data.text:
Kewin Yun says:

hi all,

i still suffering from how to differentiate which lenses are compatible with d5100. refering to nikon usa website, stated that d5100 is compatible with all nikkor lenses with AF-S and AF-I

what about dx or fx lenses?

can some1 pls advice? Thanks!

below are data from nikonusa:

www.nikonusa.com/Nikon-Products/Product/Digital-SLR-Camer...

Lens Compatibility at a Glance*** : AF-S Lens Required for Autofocus

Compatible Lenses : AF-S, AF-I: All functions supported

AI-P NIKKOR: All functions supported except 3D color matrix metering II

IX NIKKOR lenses can not be used

Non-CPU: Can be used in mode M, but exposure meter does not function; Electronic Rangefinder can be used if maximum aperture is f/5.6 or faster

Other AF NIKKOR (Excluding lenses for F3AF): All functions supported except 3D color matrix metering II

Type G or D AF NIKKOR not equipped with an autofocus motor: All functions supported except autofocus

Type D PC NIKKOR: All functions supported except autofocus and some shooting modes.

below are AF only, so not compatible??

Nikon AF DX Fisheye-Nikkor 10.5mm f/2.8G ED

Nikon AF Fisheye-Nikkor 16mm f/2.8D

Nikon AF Micro-Nikkor 200mm f/4D ED-IF

all below are AF-S, all can use with d5100???

Thanks!

kevin

Originally posted at 11:08AM, 15 June 2011 PDT

Kewin Yun edited this topic ages ago.

Kewin Yun says:

do u mean i can use all af-s lens stated on top? whats about below, the new 50mm stated compatible with fx format, does it compatible to dx d5100 also? are we going to lost some functions if apply fx format to dx format? sorry to bother but i just want to make it clear. Thanks!

AF-S NIKKOR 50mm f/1.8G

Announced : 27-04-2011

A fast, normal 50mm fixed focal length (prime) lens with a maximum aperture of f/1.8 that is compatible with Nikon FX-format digital-SLR cameras.

Originally posted ages ago.

Kewin Yun edited this topic ages ago.

peeandcat says:

DX lenses don't work as well on FX bodies so I guess the clarification is for FX users in this case. In some instances they may get vignetting for example.

FX lenses work perfectly fine on DX.

Also, you can use any Nikon lens on the D5100. Only the AF-S ones will autofocus on the D5100 though. The others will require you using the manual focus ring, (and with some of the much older ones, the aperture ring :o )

For things like landscape photography or movies, manual focusing isn't a problem and may even be a benefit. Not so good for other types of photography though.

ages ago
